name: Abengoa
overview: Abengoa, S.A., a technology company, provides solutions primarily for the energy and environment sectors. The Solar business unit develops and applies solar power technologies to handle climate change and ensure sustainability through its proprietary concentrating solar power and photovoltaic technologies. The Bioenergy business unit produces and develops biofuels for transportation. It offers bioethanol and biodiesel, which use biomass, such as cereals, sugar cane, cellulosic biomass, and oleaginous seeds as a raw material. The Environmental Services business unit engages in the integral management and recycling of industrial waste; and in the generation and management of water. This business unit provides steel waste, aluminum waste, and industrial waste recycling services, as well as designs and constructs water infrastructures and facilities, including desalination and water treatment plants, and water distribution and transport infrastructures. The Information Technologies and Services business unit offers technology solutions and business information services for energy, transportation, agriculture, and environmental sectors. The Industrial Engineering and Construction business unit provides solutions in the fields of energy, transportation, telecommunications, industry, services, and the environment. It involves in the engineering, construction, and maintenance of electric and mechanical infrastructures and instrumentation for the energy, industry, transportation, and services sectors, as well as industrial plants, conventional energy and renewable energy power plants, and power transmission lines. This business unit also offers products and services to deploy, install, and operate telecommunication networks; and produces auxiliary elements for energy and telecommunications sectors. The company operates in Europe, the United States, Latin America, Africa, Asia, and the Oceania. Abengoa, S.A. was founded in 1941 and is headquartered in Seville, Spain.

milestones.description: Abengoa offered conditional commitment for $1.2 billion Federal Loan Guarantee to build Mojave Solar Project
milestones.source_description: Abengoa offered conditional commitment for $1.2 billion Federal Loan Guarantee to build Mojave Solar Project
